metadata.description:
The first paintings with sunflowers as a motif were painted by van Gogh in the late summer of 1887 while he was living in Paris. He mentioned two of them (Two cut sunflowers (II) and (III)) only on January 17, 1889 in a letter to his brother, written after abrupt separation from Paul Gauguin

Image cut into 100 unique NFT tokens. the nominal price is 25000 ART but in addition to the price of each piece there is a 500% reward added.
Each piece of image increases by 0.5% (compound percentage)

Rewards for collecting pieces of painting are automatically paid out by the smartcontract. The reward system is a fibonacci sequence and is paid consecutively for collecting such an amount of NFT 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8, 13, 21, 34, 55, 89% (pieces)

The main prize is 40% (66520 ART) of the collected amount + 2% fee from trading on the secondary market. It is paid to the wallet owner who collects 100 NFT from this collection.
metadata.name: Sunflowers - 1
